Union Canal
===========

The Union Canal is one of Scotland's most picturesque inland waterways, stretching from Edinburgh to Falkirk. This historic canal, built in the early 19th century, features a peaceful towpath ideal for leisurely walks. The canal passes through charming villages, alongside historic sites, and through scenic countryside, making it a perfect destination for walkers of all abilities.

The walks documented here showcase different sections of the Union Canal, each offering unique views and experiences along this remarkable heritage route.

Walks on the Union Canal
------------------------

* **Edinburgh To Ratho** - A scenic urban to suburban walk starting from the heart of Edinburgh
* **Winchburgh To Ratho** - A scenic journey through canal-side villages and countryside
* **Winchburgh To Linlithgow** - An easy, accessible walk ending at the historic royal town of Linlithgow
